definitions.definition: The act of moving slowly on hands and knees etc, or with frequent stops.
A rapid swimming stroke with alternate overarm strokes and a fluttering kick.

definitions.example: My computer has slowed down to a crawl since I installed that software package.

definitions.definition: A piece of horizontally or vertically scrolling text overlaid on the main image.
To creep; to move slowly on hands and knees, or by dragging the body along the ground.
definitions.example: Clutching my wounded side, I crawled back to the trench.

definitions.definition: To move forward slowly, with frequent stops.
definitions.example: The rush-hour traffic crawled around the bypass.

definitions.definition: To act in a servile manner.
definitions.example: Don't come crawling to me with your useless apologies!
The horrible sight made my skin crawl.

definitions.definition: To swim using the crawl stroke.
definitions.example: I think I'll crawl the next hundred metres.

definitions.definition: To move over an area on hands and knees.
definitions.example: The baby crawled the entire second floor.

definitions.definition: To visit files or web sites in order to index them for searching.
definitions.example: Yahoo Search has updated its Slurp Crawler to crawl web sites faster and more efficiently.

definitions.definition: A pen or enclosure of stakes and hurdles for holding fish.
